title: Owner initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the smart contract owner.
whitepaper: The owner of the smart contract is initialized to the sender of the transaction that deploys the contract, as set in the constructor function. An event `OwnershipTransferred` is emitted with the address of the new owner when the contract is deployed.
code: The owner of the smart contract is initialized to the address that deploys the contract, which is set during the execution of the constructor function. The constructor sets the sender's address (`msg.sender`) as the owner and emits an `OwnershipTransferred` event with the new owner's address.

title: Minter initialization
description: Determine the initialization process of the token Minter.
whitepaper: The minter of the token is not directly initialized in the provided context; however, there is a mapping called `minters` that likely tracks addresses that are allowed to mint tokens. Initialization of a minter would involve setting an address to `true` in this mapping, which is suggested by the requirement check `require(minters[_minter], "not a minter");` indicating that the `_minter` address must be set as a minter in the mapping to proceed with minting-related functions.
code: The minter of the token is initialized through a mapping that associates addresses with a boolean value, where an address set to true is designated as a minter. The `masterMinter` is also set during initialization, which is a specific address with the authority to manage minters.
